poem:
"Against Unjust Accusations"

The plums of truth,
in the prohibited icebox of misunderstanding,
touched by soft accusations.
Students, red and purple,
launch their words
in the darkened kitchen of courts,
seeking light – a freedom,
an accord in uncomfortable silence.
Payments whispered,
but wider ripples are hungry,
thirsting for more than 
just an apology,
but the radiance of righteous reckoning.
